item.title: Hossein add a quote by Victor Hugo
item.description: "Have courage for the great sorrows of life and patience for the small ones; and when you have laboriously accomplished your daily task, go to sleep in peace. God is awake." -- Victor Hugo

item.title: Hossein add a quote by Kahlil Gibran
item.description: "When you are sorrowful look again in your heart, and you shall see that in truth you are weeping for that which has been your delight." -- Kahlil Gibran

item.title: Hossein add a quote by Kahlil Gibran
item.description: "We choose our joys and sorrows long before we experience them." -- Kahlil Gibran

item.title: Hossein add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Where there is sorrow, there is holy ground." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Hossein add a quote by Dante Alighieri
item.description: "There is no greater sorrow Than to recall a happy time When miserable." -- Dante Alighieri

item.title: Hossein add a quote by Frida Kahlo
item.description: "I drank to drown my sorrows, but the damned things learned how to swim." -- Frida Kahlo

item.title: Hossein add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "When sorrows come, they come not single spies. But in battalions!" -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Hossein add a quote by Anonymous
item.description: "For with much wisdom comes much sorrow; the more knowledge the more grief." -- Anonymous

item.title: Hossein add a quote by Rainer Maria Rilke
item.description: "If you are patient in one moment of anger, you will escape a hundred days of sorrow" -- Rainer Maria Rilke

item.title: Hossein add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "The secret source of humor is not joy but sorrow; there is no humor in heaven." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Hossein add a quote by Marcel Proust
item.description: "The thirst for something other than what we haveâ€¦to bring something new, even if it is worse, some emotion, some sorrow; when our sensibility, which happiness has silenced like an idle harp, wants to resonate under some hand, even a rough one, and even if it might be broken by it." -- Marcel Proust

item.title: Hossein add a quote by Milan Kundera
item.description: "And therein lies the whole of man's plight. Human time does not turn in a circle; it runs ahead in a straight line. That is why man cannot be happy: happiness is the longing for repetition." -- Milan Kundera

item.title: Hossein add a quote by Anton Chekhov
item.description: "You have lost your reason and taken the wrong path. You have taken lies for truth, and hideousness for beauty. You would marvel if, owing to strange events of some sorts, frogs and lizards suddenly grew on apple and orange trees instead of fruit, or if roses began to smell like a sweating horse; so I marvel at you who exchange heaven for earth. I don't want to understand you." -- Anton Chekhov

item.title: Hossein add a quote by Pablo Neruda
item.description: "I love you without knowing how, or when, or from where. I love you simply, without problems or pride: I love you in this way because I do not know any other way of loving but this, in which there is no I or you, so intimate that your hand upon my chest is my hand, so intimate that when I fall asleep your eyes close." -- Pablo Neruda

item.title: Hossein add a quote by Borges, Jorge Luis
item.description: "There is nothing in the world that is not mysterious, but the mystery is more evident in certain things than in others: in the sea, in the eyes of the elders, in the color yellow, and in music." -- Borges, Jorge Luis

item.title: Hossein add a quote by Jorge Luis Borges
item.description: "Loneliness does not worry me; life is difficult enough, putting up with yourself and with your own habits." -- Jorge Luis Borges

item.title: Hossein add a quote by Jorge Luis Borges
item.description: "All theories are legitimate, no matter. What matters is what you do with them." -- Jorge Luis Borges
